channel.title: Hm i need some help

item.title: Hm i need some help
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

I’m trying to make Woodcutting ‘loop’ so i have came up with this.

for (int wcz = 0; wcz < WCTimer; wcz++) {
if(wcz == 0){
if(actionTimer <= 0){
if(playerLevel[8] >= RequiredLvl){
addItem(LogID, AmountToChop);
sendMessage("You chop some "+LogName+"'s");
addSkillXP(ExpPerLog, 8);
wcz = WCTimer;
}
}
}
}

But it never works properly… Basically in the method say if WCTimer is 50, it keeps taking 1 away until it reaches 0, then when it reaches 0 it does the:

if(playerLevel[8] >= RequiredLvl){
addItem(LogID, AmountToChop);
sendMessage("You chop some "+LogName+"'s");
addSkillXP(ExpPerLog, 8);

Part and puts the ‘loop’ back to the number [50 in this example] and then it counts down to 0 again and keeps doing this… Any idea what i’m doing wrong?

Read full topic
